titleStmt.title: Upon report of the Lords committees appointed to consider of the priviledges of the peers of this realm it is ordered and declared by the Lords in Parliament assembled, that it is the undoubted right of the peers of this realm, not to be charged with any horse, armes, or other martial charge whatsoever ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Lords.

notesStmt.note: Title from first 5 lines of text.
At head of title: Die Lunæ, 17. die Decembris, 1660.
"Saturday the 29. day of December, 1660. Ordered by the Lords in Parliament assembled, that this order be forthwith printed and published. Jo. Browne cleric. Parliamentorum."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
